books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic of English literature about how pride and prejudice can affect romantic relationships.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
books.description: The story of six generations of a Colombian family struggling to maintain their roots while trying to survive in a changing world.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A story of love and desperation set in the jazz age of New York during Prohibition.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: The story of Scout Finch, an Alabama girl who learns the truth about intolerance and justice in the 1930s.

books.title: The Metamorphosis
books.author: Franz Kafka
books.description: The story of Gregor Samsa, a man who wakes up one morning turned into an insect, and how this affects his family and life.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenage outcast who's kicked out of his prep school and wanders around New York City.

books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.description: The story of Huck Finn, a young boy who fakes his own death to escape his abusive father and goes on a journey down the Mississippi river with a runaway slave.

books.title: The Stranger
books.author: Albert Camus
books.description: The story of Meursault, a detached and emotionally apathetic man who becomes embroiled in a murder trial.

books.title: The Bell Jar
books.author: Sylvia Plath
books.description: The story of Esther Greenwood, a young woman who becomes increasingly disillusioned with her life and descends into mental illness.

books.title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a near-future society where women's rights have been severely curtailed and they are forced into reproductive servitude.

books.title: The Yellow Wallpaper
books.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman
books.description: The story of a woman who is suffering from postpartum depression and is confined to her bedroom by her husband, with disturbing consequences.

books.title: The Waste Land
books.author: T.S. Eliot
books.description: A landmark of modernist poetry, exploring themes of disillusionment, despair, and the fragmentation of modern society.
